name: places/ChIJg_8o6ThawokREmtsK7jXGZQ
formattedAddress: 150 Furman St Pier 2, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA
adrFormatAddress: 150 Furman St Pier 2, Brooklyn, NY 11201, USA

editorialSummary.text: Greenspace featuring basketball, handball, shuffleboard & bocce ball courts, plus a roller rink.

originalText.text: absolutely beautiful rink, reasonably priced and stunning views of downtown. We went at sunset and the sun sets right over the water. giving 3 stars because for the actual purpose of rollerskating this is not a great rink. surface is not great - this weird rubber grid that vibrates your feet and makes it feel scary to do tricks and spins on. this rink is for beginners, kids and date night but not good if you love skating and doing tricks.

text.text: absolutely beautiful rink, reasonably priced and stunning views of downtown. We went at sunset and the sun sets right over the water. giving 3 stars because for the actual purpose of rollerskating this is not a great rink. surface is not great - this weird rubber grid that vibrates your feet and makes it feel scary to do tricks and spins on. this rink is for beginners, kids and date night but not good if you love skating and doing tricks.

originalText.text:
EDIT---after the owner explained in reply to this message, I can see his perspective.  I didn't know it had been open at all that day.  We got the impression that they just closed a day early, contrary to the website.  I'll remove the review after a day so the owner can see my reply.
------

My out-of-town group specifically planned our evening around the public skate on the evening of October 29.  In fact we even walked across the Brooklyn Bridge in the rain to get there - only to find out they closed for the season. This is despite the fact the the website advertises a public skate all day.  (Picture included).  I called the office while there to get an explanation.  Still waiting for a return call.

originalText.text: Thank you mister Mr Alan my kids had a great time we will definitely be back!!! Thank you so much for helping my sons skate properly and taking the time to show them how to tie there skates. they both truly can’t wait to come back and see Mr Alan and spider man

originalText.text: Is a beautiful park,  I went for my kids to go roller skate just to find out that part is closed. So that was disappointing thankfully my kids found a basketball to play with.  But overall nice big park for kids to do sports.

originalText.text: Excellent place to take your family for an outing or to hold a party.  Great service, and an even better park.  Brooklyn Bridge Park is surely a fantastic place to see in New York!
